fr.theshark34.openauth

Class Authenticator

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.theshark34.openauth.Authenticator

  • public class Authenticator
extends java.lang.Object
    The Authenticator

    The mainc class of the lib, use it to authenticate a user !

    • Method Detail

      • authenticate

        public AuthResponse authenticate(AuthAgent agent,
                        java.lang.String username,
                        java.lang.String password,
                        java.lang.String clientToken)
                          throws AuthenticationException
        Authenticates an user using his password.
        Parameters:
        agent - The auth agent (optional)
        username - User mojang account name
        password - User mojang account password
        clientToken - The client token (optional, like a key for the access token)
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException

      • refresh

        public RefreshResponse refresh(java.lang.String accessToken,
                      java.lang.String clientToken)
                        throws AuthenticationException
        Refresh a valid access token. It can be uses to keep a user logged in between gaming sessions and is preferred over storing the user's password in a file.
        Parameters:
        accessToken - The saved access token
        clientToken - The saved client token (need to be the same used when authenticated to get the acces token)
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException

      • validate

        public void validate(java.lang.String accessToken)
              throws AuthenticationException
        Check if an access token is a valid session token with a currently-active session. Note: this method will not respond successfully to all currently-logged-in sessions, just the most recently-logged-in for each user. It is intended to be used by servers to validate that a user should be connecting (and reject users who have logged in elsewhere since starting Minecraft), NOT to auth that a particular session token is valid for authentication purposes. To authenticate a user by session token, use the refresh verb and catch resulting errors.
        Parameters:
        accessToken - The access token to check
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException

      • signout

        public void signout(java.lang.String username,
           java.lang.String password)
             throws AuthenticationException
        Invalidates accessTokens using an account's username and password
        Parameters:
        username - User mojang account name
        password - User mojang account password
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException

      • invalidate

        public void invalidate(java.lang.String accessToken,
              java.lang.String clientToken)
                throws AuthenticationException
        Invalidates accessTokens using a client/access token pair
        Parameters:
        accessToken - Valid access token to invalidate
        clientToken - Client token used when authenticated to get the access token
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException
